longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency and temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Nationals of Slovenia;
Minors:
- Passengers up to/including 16 years:
   
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Slovenia will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors must hold at least USD 50.- per person per day and
  documents required for their next destination. 
- Extension of stay possible for those listed under visa
  exemptions.
Warning:
- Nationals of Slovenia who have visited Congo (Dem. Rep.),
  Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria or Sierra Leone within the last 30
  days will be refused entry. 
- Nationals and alien residents of Belize, who have visited
  Congo (Dem. Rep), Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria or Sierra Leone
  within the last 30 days are subject to screening and health
  checks. Passengers may be quarantined for further
  assessment.
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry;
 - not applicable to visitors born in Belize
vaccination:
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission For details, click here
and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to medical screening and quarantine upon arrival.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very low and is limited and negligible in most
  areas. Recommended prevention in risk areas: A.
